Legal
No Mixed Federal Funds: Each company uses different federal programs. The homeownership
company uses Mortgage Revenue Bonds. The apartment company uses Multifamily Housing
Bonds. These are completely separate federal programs.
Business Investment, Not Subsidy: The Master Entity makes a business decision to invest its
profits. This is like any company deciding to invest earnings in a new venture. It's not a
government subsidy between programs.

Sequential Timing: We complete the home sales first. Then we use those profits for the
apartments. This clear sequence prevents any appearance of mixing federal funds.
Separate Everything: Each company has its own:
● Bank accounts
● Financial records
● Loan documents
● Legal obligations
● No company is responsible for another's debts

The Financial Strength

For the Workforce Homes
● Teachers, nurses, and firefighters can afford these homes
● At $285,000, monthly payments are about $1,800
● This is affordable for families earning $65,000 per year
● Homes will sell quickly in Mobile's hot market
For the Apartments
● Rent of $1,298 per month (including utilities)
● Affordable for families earning $45,000 per year
● We collect 3.7 times more money than we need for debt payments
● This huge cushion means the project is very safe
For the Housing Authority
● No taxpayer money needed
